Operation 'otcer' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'OTV Certificate' is a noun phrase lacking action orientation. Description 'API to verify OTV Certificate' is extremely vague and provides no context about inputs, outputs, or the domain-specific purpose. Based on API context, OTV certificates are issued to qualified candidates for government sector appointments. Enhanced version includes: (1) action-oriented summary with domain context, (2) expanded description explaining the certificate's purpose in the appointment process, (3) clarification of what is being verified (qualifications, age, documents), (4) indication of expected inputs and outputs, (5) use of consistent terminology from API documentation (OTV, government sector, appointment verification). This significantly improves AI agent interpretability for determining when to invoke this operation.

data.summary_suggestion: Verify One Time Verification certificate for appointment
data.description_suggestion: Verifies the One Time Verification (OTV) certificate issued to candidates qualified for government sector appointment. This operation validates the candidate's OTV certificate against their qualifications, age, and other relevant documents as required by the recruiting department. Accepts certificate details and candidate information as input. Returns verification status and certificate validity details. Used by government departments during the appointment verification process.

This significantly improves AI agent interpretability for determining when to invoke this operation.
